Item Effects: Life-size decoy used to escape wild Pokémon. Some people like to collect them.
Most Pokémon won’t come near to you for a whole day. The smell is now machine-washable.
A pocket sized spray potion to relieve the pain and heal bruises.
A regular can of concentrated formula spray. This potion can close open wounds and even heal a cracked bone.
Best value pack. It can be rationed for smaller injuries on the team, or used all at once on a serious wound.
A single-use capsule of formula. The Pokémon won’t be able to restore health further until the next day.
A single-use capsule of deluxe formula. The Pokémon won’t be able to restore health further until the next day.
A shot that quickly reduces the fever and relieves the pain. Heals Poison and Poison+.
Sprays a water-based solution to awake a drowsy Pokémon. Heals Sleep.
A powder that douses the fire and aids in the healing of the burnt area. Heals Burn 1, 2, and 3.
Recovers the normal temperature of the Pokémon and heals frost biting. Heals Frozen Solid.
This ointment relaxes the muscles and stops the cramping. Heals Paralysis.
A superior spray formula that can heal any status problem in a second. Heals all status ailments.
This sour berry shakes the body and rises its temperature, thawing any ice surrounding it. Heals Frozen Solid.
Its spicy flavor reinvigorates the muscles and stops the cramping. Heals Paralysis.
It is difficult to eat, so tough and dry that it will heal the drowsiness. Heals Sleep.
A delicious citric berry that numbs pain away. Heals 1 HP
This berry’s sweet pulp will absorb simple poison out of the bloodstream. Heals Poison and Poison+.
A strong flavored berry to snap out of confusion. Heals Confusion.
Its liquid pulp is ideal to stop fire from spreading and numbs the pain on the area, it is quite bitter, though. Heals Burn 1 and 2.
A bigger and sweeter berry from the Oran family but scarcer in the wild. Heals 3 HP or 1 Lethal Damage.
This berry is said to cure everything, it is however very rare to find. Heals all status ailments.
A nasty tasting root with mystical properties that can be eaten whole or turned into up to 4 batches of powder if you know how to do it. Equal to a Hyper Potion
This powder leaves a horrid aftertaste, but at least it stops the pain. Equal to a Super Potion
A mix of the most foul looking herbs you can find can make this cure-all powder. Heals all status ailments.
It may be its magical properties or just its awful flavor, but this herb will get you back into consciousness numbing all the pain away. Extremely rare to find. Equal to a Max Revive
A small energy shard that brings a fainted Human or Pokémon back into conciousness and stabilizes their wounds. Recover 1 HP and restores consciousness.
A bigger shard that is not available to the public. Restores full HP and restores consciousness.
This mixed drink of various berries is also quite refreshing. Some Pokémon produce it naturally. Restores 2 HP.
Full of electrolytes and just the right amount of sodium, restores the vitality of those who are tired. Restores 4 HP
This Sugary drink gives you a quick shot of energy after being quite tired. Restores 5 HP
The Citric boost and added vitamins make this a favorite after exercise. Restores 6 HP.
Found in organic farms, this milk is full of calcium and is right out of the Miltank. Restores 7 HP.
A basic ball for catching Pokémon and carrying heavy items.
A sturdier barrier protects the seal allowing an easier catch.
The best seal in the market to ensure the catch of stronger Pokémon.
It is said to be in development by some companies in the world, it is rumored to have a seal so strong it would never break.
A tasty milkshake that aids in the growth of bigger and stronger muscles.
An iron capsule that reduces feebleness and gives you a healthy glow.
Add this effervescent pills on their drink to help grow stronger bones.
Zinc capsules help with focus and brain development.
A healthy syrup that fills you with energy!
It is rumored they are just sugar pills. Who really knows?
A compendium of vitamins and minerals to help your Pokémon grow as big and healthy as it can be.
This strange candy is made of unknown ingredients but its effects do not stack.
This Stone has a flame inside, it’s hot to the touch. Evolves certain Pokemon
It glows in the dark and can be used to power small electronics. Evolves certain Pokemon
Looks like blue glass and can be found at the bottom of the sea. Evolves certain Pokemon
It is said that the leaf encrusted to it comes from the tree of life itself. Evolves certain Pokemon
It is a black stone that turns white and luminescent when the moon shines over it. Evolves certain Pokemon
A red stone that shines brightly when facing the sun at morning. Evolves certain Pokemon
Its crystal-like surface allows you to see a ball of light inside. Evolves certain Pokemon
This stone seems to suck the light around into a small dark hole. Evolves certain Pokemon
This cerulean stone shines with blinding light for a minute during sunrise. Evolves certain Pokemon
This arctic blue stone is cold to the touch and seems to chill the air around it. Evolves certain Pokemon
After years of training in martial arts you can proudly wear this. Adds 1 damage to Fighting type moves.
These glasses make you look cool and mean. Adds 1 damage to Dark type moves.
A piece of special charcoal that never turns to ash and keeps a steady flame. Adds 1 damage to Fire type moves.
A Dragon Pokémon that fought fiercely lost this fang. It’s sprit lives within. Adds 1 damage to Dragon type moves.
A Stone that is embed on the body to protect it from impact. Adds 1 damage to Rock type moves.
This magnet keeps positive and negative charge within itself. Adds 1 damage to Electric type moves.
This chromed coat keeps all surfaces shiny. Adds 1 damage to Steel type moves.
It is said that this seed came from the same forest as the tree of life. Adds 1 damage to Grass type moves.
A small vessel with water that emits a mysterious glow. Adds 1 damage to Water type moves.
A magical piece of ice that never melts. Adds 1 damage to Ice type moves.
This poison-infused barb is sure to take the toxines into the foe. Adds 1 damage to Poison type moves.
A sharp metal cover for the beak of your Pokémon. Adds 1 damage to Flying type moves.
Just a regular everyday normal scarf. Nothing special about it. Adds 1 damage to Normal type moves.
Be careful as this powder is itchy and gives you allergies. Adds 1 damage to Bug type moves.
A pouch with special sand that’s smooth and soft to the touch. Adds 1 damage to Ground type moves.
An old piece of paper that once sealed the spirit of an angry spirit. Adds 1 damage to Ghost type moves.
A spoon that bends with the power of the mind. Adds 1 damage to Psychic type moves.
A rare ball of light that reacts only to a Pikachu’s energy. Increases Strength and Special by 2.
A set of boxing gloves specially fit for a Chansey or Blissey’s arms. Increases Strength by 2.
A piece of Leek that allows Farfetch’d to fight swiftly. You can also cook it, since it's apparently delicious. High Crit.
A heavy bone piece, only Cubone and Marowak react to the remains. Increases Strength by 2.
A good luck charm that is said to bring money to your pocket. If your Pokémon wears it, it will bring you fortune. Doubles any earned prize money.
A strange lump that boosts the defenses of an un-evolved Pokémon. Increases Defense and Special Defense.
The belt of a seasoned warrior who knows many techniques. Adds 1 damage to Super Effective Moves.
A magic orb that grants great power at the cost of the life energy of the weilder. Adds 2 damage & recoil to all attacks
A crown-shaped rock that makes some Pokémon feel like a king, others can’t help but stare in awe at royalty. All moves have 1 Chance Die to Flinch.
When the Pokémon defeats a foe, it will count as two victories for the purposes of Evolution.
This claw allows you a firm grip on the ground to move faster. Add +2 to your Initiative.
This sharp claw can pierce through tough surfaces with ease. High Crit.
A big pair of fangs that make you look like a vampire. All moves have 1 Chance Die to Flinch.
A helmet covered with sharp edges and rocks. Deal 1 damage to a foe attacking you with a Non-ranged Physical Attack.
A magnifying glass used to see the small details. All moves have +1 Accuracy.
